title: Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) User Training Protocol Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Neuroscience and Computer Engineering Knowledge, with EEG Data Interpretation Skills
context.additional_context: Skill acquisition through hands-on use of actual BCI equipment and project-based collaborative learning.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operating principles of BCI systems and the EEG signal processing process.
Learners can generate stable mental imagery patterns with over 80% accuracy to control BCI interfaces.
Learners can design personalized BCI training protocols through team projects and validate their effectiveness.
Learners can analyze error factors occurring during BCI training and propose improvement measures.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
